mainText:
Welcome to Bank of Entitlement, where you're always right and entitled to everything you desire. Fulfill your wildest dreams with us! 

Visit Bank of Entitlement dot com for more.

ENTITLEMENT STORY: So, I was at a fancy restaurant, ready to impress my date with my sophisticated taste. Everything was going smoothly until the waiter brought me the wrong dish-I mean, can you believe the audacity? I calmly but firmly explained that I ordered the lobster thermidor, not the shrimp scampi. But instead of apologizing, the waiter had the nerve to argue with me, insisting that I had indeed ordered the shrimp. Well, that simply would not do.I felt a surge of entitlement course through me, and before I knew it, I was up on my feet, demanding to see the manager. When the manager arrived, looking slightly intimidated (as they should be in the presence of greatness), I recounted the egregious injustice I had suffered. I made it clear that not only did I deserve a complimentary lobster thermidor, but I also expected a discount on the entire meal for the inconvenience and emotional distress caused by their incompetence.After a brief moment of negotiation (which really meant me dictating the terms), the manager caved in to my demands and offered to cover the cost of the meal and provide a gift card for my next visit. As I sat back down at my table, lobster thermidor finally in front of me, I couldn't help but feel a sense of satisfaction. In the end, justice was served, and my entitlement had prevailed once again. Ah, the sweet taste of victory-it's almost as delicious as that perfectly cooked lobster.
